intro: Cousinia schtschurowskiana, commonly known as the Karakoram hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas and Central Asia. It is characterized by its dense, silver-gray foliage and bright yellow composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand cold temperatures and strong winds. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine. Cousinia schtschurowskiana plays a vital role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists and ecologists.
